str2: To send, transmit, permit to go, put forth.

str2: To turn back, return. From hupo and strepho; to turn under, i.e. To return.
A primary preposition; to or into, of place, time, or purpose; also in adverbial phrases.

A dwelling; by implication, a family.

str2: A prolonged form of a primary heuro, which heureo is used for it in all the tenses except the present and imperfect to find.
The, the definite article. Including the feminine he, and the neuter to in all their inflections; the definite article; the.
(a) (as adj.) enslaved, (b) (as noun) a (male) slave. From deo; a slave.

parse: Verb - Present Participle Active - Accusative Masculine Singular
str2: From hugies; to have sound health, i.e. Be well; figuratively, to be uncorrupt.
